bibl.title: Letter from George Parker to Henry Rose Carter, December 5, 1922

div1.p: Parker discusses his formula to compute economic losses due to malaria.

div1.head: Letter from George Parker to Henry Rose Carter, December 5, 1922
div1.opener:

BUREAU OF SANITARY ENGINEERING
----
H. A. KROEZE, C. E.,
State Sanitary Engineer
Yazoo City, Miss.,
Dec. 5, 1922.
Dear Doctor Carter:-
div1.p:
In my letter of the 25th of November, I took
for a basis of the first two equations the malaria
rate of the state which is represented in the first
fraction: of this I allowed 75% as the amount of
the whole in the rural districts; then I apply this
rate (now considered as the per cent of loss) to the
average value per acre of improved farm land - the
land that is populated and used-, and called this
the economic los per acre - or that per cent
in dollars which represents the money expended
per acre in labor for which no production is had.

Then in the second equation with the result
of the first as I base, I added a profit of
20% which, as a minimum gain should have
been the farmer's profit - and as he didn't get
a profit on the expenditure the profit he should
have made is also a loss.

The basic figures of the lost equations are
actual and are taken from official records.

W.W. HALL, M.D., PRES. SHIRLEY, MISS.
J.H. McNEILL, M.D., OLIVE BRANCH, MISS.
D. LAMPTON CRAWFORD, M.D., TYL MISS.
T.F. ELMIN, M.D., JUFELD, MISS.
H.F. GARRISON, M.D., CLU MISS.
L.L. McDODSAL, M.D., BOONVILLE, MISS.
T.W. REAGAN, M.D., UNION MISS.
C.D. MITCHELL, M.D., JACKSON, MISS.
I.L. PARSONS, M.D., BA MISS.
E.M. GAVIN, M.D., OVE MISS.
W.H. WATSON, M.D., BARANGA MISS.
J.H. WINDHAM, M.D., EC, MISS.
MISSISSIPPI STATE BOARD OF HEALTH
Mississippi State Board of Health
W.S. LEATHERS, M.D., EXECUTIVE OFFICER
JACKSON, MISS.
BUREAU OF SANITARY ENGINEERING
----
H. A. KROEZE, C. E.,
State Sanitary Engineer
I have made no effort to compute the loss
in production, but have considered labor
only.

Perhaps this method is not applicable to
the work at hand, and before making official
use of it I wanted your criticism.
Thank you for Dr. Hanson's address.

It is warm enough here now for a new
brood of mosquitoes to come through - and
has been so for several days.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, George Parker. Dr. H. R. Carter,
Asst. Surg. General, U. S. P. H. S.,
Washington, D C
